campaign.story:
Hi, my name is Mr Muju
I'm an artist based in St Ives, a coastal town in Cornwall, UK.  
My partner Miss Muju & I based our Art Studio here 10 years ago. I produce drawings, paintings & prints, and Miss Muju produces limited edition sculptures in a range of different mediums. We both work full time on a variety of creative projects, and have been exhibiting and selling artwork to a worldwide audience for over 10 years. 
You can check out more of our work at www.mujuworld.co.uk
You can follow more Mujuworld news & studio life on our social media : https://www.instagram.com/mr_muju/
https://www.instagram.com/miss_muju/
Mujuworld is an imaginary dimension where the landscapes are alive and populated by a diverse range of Spirits.  The natural environment of Mujuworld is cared for by a wide variety of beings, including Tree Spirits, Leaf Spirits, Ocean Guardians and Cosmic Owls.  You may find them wandering amongst the Happy Hills & Mystic Mountains. 
There are many stories to discover within Mujuworld  and our mission is to explore and find them all. 
Magic Seeds Comic - Working Cover
I have always wanted to create a Mujuworld Comic for a worldwide audience.  So I started to develop a comic book idea that used images to create a totally visual narrative, a story suitable for all ages no matter what language you speak.
The process of storyboarding this comic has taken many months of development and editing.
I now have the complete book worked out and illustrated.
The inking has been finished and I am now working on the final colour artwork.
There will be over 60 pages of full colour illustrations in the book. 
Magic Seeds - Sample Pages
Magic Seeds - Sample Pages
Magic Seeds - Sample Pages
Magic Seeds - Sample Pages
The story features a Muju Spirit on a journey into the unknown, overcoming challenges, meeting new friends & exploring new dimensions within the mysterious Mujuworld.
I have already invested a huge amount of time & energy into this project & I hope you will be inspired to support me in finishing & publishing this first Mujuworld Tale.
Pre-orders of the book will enable me to fund the first print edition & share this story with fans of Mujuworld all over the world. 
The book will be hardback A4 size, printed on heavyweight uncoated paper and produced in the UK by a trusted book printer with a good reputation for quality.
Signed copies are available in a limited quantity, as well as some special sculpture rewards featuring characters from the story. 
Original ink drawings featuring characters from the book are also available, please check out all the Rewards we have on offer below :)
Miss Muju sculpting the Magic Seed Collector
The Magic Seeds - Hardback book : £25
The Magic Seeds - Signed copy : £30
Muju Daydreamer Sculpture
Muju Daydreamer & 'The Magic Seeds' book reward : £75
This special Kickstarter edition of the Muju Daydreamer is limited to just 50 pieces. Each one is handcast and painted in the Muju Studio, and is 8cm tall.
The Daydreamer reward also comes with a hardback copy of 'The Magic Seeds' book.
The Magic Seed Collector Sculpture - Limited Edition of 3 : £430
The Magic Seed Collector Sculpture - Details
The Magic Seed Collector bio-resin sculpture stands 8 inches tall.  This exclusive Kickstarter edition is limited to just 3 pieces.  Each one comes with a Spirit House staff,  felt travelling bag, jar of seeds, and a Muju bird companion.
This reward also comes with a signed hardback copy of 'The Magic Seeds' book.
Muju Voyager - Original Pencil Drawing : £550
If you want to add-on any extras to your chosen reward you can! 
How do I do that?  
You can adjust your pledge amount at any point to add extras to your reward options. Simply click the "manage your pledge" button here on the page, and then you can increase your pledge by the desired amount, without having to change your selected reward tier.  For example :
Add £25 to your pledge = receive an extra copy of the Magic Seeds book
After the campaign ends I will send out a survey to each backer to finalise what you want to add-on.  This will make sure you get exactly what you pledged for.  
If you have any questions about add-on options you can message me for more details!

campaign.story:
Welcome to Themeborne’s third Kickstarter campaign. 
Whether you're a returning backer or just discovering the Escape the Dark™ series for the first time, this new campaign is for you.    
With great pleasure we introduce our latest game: Escape the Dark Sector™.
Fans of Escape the Dark Castle™ will feel right at home with Sector’s core gameplay, and should check out the What’s New? section below to discover its exciting new features.
Newcomers, a warm welcome to the Escape the Dark™ community. This is a great starting point for you, and if you’re curious about the journey so far you can view our previous campaign here.
Wherever you hail from, step aboard with us now as we launch the series into the farthest reaches of space…
Escape the Dark Sector™  is a simple, sci-fi adventure game with a focus on atmosphere, storytelling, and player cooperation – perfect for newcomers to tabletop gaming. It takes about 2 minutes to set up, lasts around 45 minutes, and no two games are ever the same.
Playing as the beleaguered crew of an impounded starship, players find themselves confined to the detention block of a vast space station. Using a variety of advanced gear and weaponry, they will embark on a desperate mission to find their ship and blast their way home.
Over the course of three acts the crew will have to overcome a variety of dangers, from cyborg guards and faulty replicators to killer alien organisms - each of which is represented by a large, beautifully illustrated chapter card.
As these immersive chapter cards are revealed one by one, the game takes on the form of a shared storybook experience, with the players making decisions about what to do each chapter before using a combination of dice and item cards to complete the challenges before them.
The goal of the game is to complete every chapter in the mission deck, and then defeat the final boss. To win, you must keep each member of the crew alive. If any player is killed the game ends immediately!
Escape the Dark Sector™ is inspired by classic sci-fi books, films, and TV programmes, including Alien, the original Star Wars trilogy, and Star Trek: The Next Generation to name a few – and of course, this being part of the Escape the Dark™ series, it also has its roots in the classic adventure experiences of the Fighting Fantasy gamebooks and the Dungeons & Dragons roleplaying game. 
Escape the Dark Sector™  has simple rules so it’s easy to learn. You’ll be able to get started within about 5 minutes. Below is a step-by-step overview, or scroll down for a gameplay video. If you’re interested in learning more you can read a very early draft of the rule book here. 
Keen to know what it's like to play Escape the Dark Sector? 
Sit back and enjoy this demo game with the team at On Tabletop: 
At its core, Escape the Dark Sector™ utilities the same narrative game engine as Castle, but adds several new features that make it a different experience altogether: 
 A 3-Act Adventure: The chapter cards which make up the mission deck are divided into three acts, each getting progressively more challenging as the mission goes on and each also offering different item drop-rates and a different ratio of encounter types - allowing for a new layer of decision making and strategy. 
 Thrilling Ranged Combat: From lowly Slug-pistols to formidable Beam-emitters, a ranged combat system has been designed from the ground up to add thrilling firefights to the adventure. But even with an array of weaponry at your disposal, teamwork remains vital to mission success. 
 Tactical Combat Actions: As the game’s intense firefights play out, the highly-trained crew have a wide selection of tactical options at their disposal - including Shoot, Charge, Take Cover, Flank, Ambush, Treat Wounds, and Reload. Forming a robust plan of attack is essential to taking down tough enemies. 
 Cybernetic Implants: Each member of the crew is fitted with a interchangeable neural-augmentation chip, giving them a unique enhancement to call upon during the adventure - from pain inhibitors to advanced-reflexes. Players will have the option to switch these out, either to swap with another member of the crew or to replace them with upgrades found along the way  - but doing so incurs an HP penalty! 
You can find more information about these and other features of the game, in our early draft rulebook here. 
Here's an interview with co-designer Thomas Pike, talking in more detail about some of the game's features: 
Since the game is still in development, the exact contents may vary from that shown here.
 What makes the ESCAPE THE DARK™ series different?
• It’s approachable - The game is designed with non-gamers in mind, but is no less rich and rewarding for it. Now anyone can enjoy the atmosphere of a classic sci-fi mission. 
• It’s quick - It takes less than 5 mins to set up and around 45 mins to play. No downtime, no elimination, and full player engagement throughout. No-one will be bored.
• It’s social - Many chapters offer a the group a choice, stimulating regular player interaction and discussion. It's perfect for the pub or a games cafe, but can even be played solo!
• It's different every time - You never know what the next chapter will be, so there is plenty of tension and suspense as your unique adventure unfolds each game.
• It has a unique look - Many games look alike these days. Here is something truly distinct for your collection. We've worked hard to create a stylish look evocative of retro classics.
• There are no heroes - The playable characters are refreshingly ordinary. No musclebound heroes or buxom heroines here, and there is an equal mix of male and female characters.  
• You'll be part of something big – With a wide range of Escape the Dark products already released, a wealth of adventure awaits you. Join our ever-growing community of players!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Is the game any good?

Our first game, Escape the Dark Castle, was highly praised, garnering dozens of positive reviews and selling well across the world. It currently holds a rating of 8/10 of board game geek. It has so far been released in three languages and more will follow. 

Escape the Dark Sector is still in development, but we're building on the solid foundations of the same, tried and tested game engine, carefully adding tasteful new gameplay elements which embrace the new theme. Everything will be thoroughly tested before release to ensure this too is an immersive and fun experience for all. As we enter our third campaign, we're confident in what we create. 

Will the materials be good quality?

Our manufacturing partner Dofine Games did an amazing job producing the Escape the Dark Castle range to our demanding standards. We're glad to say we will be working with Dofine again so we can be sure to maintain Themeborne's high standard of quality with Escape the Dark Sector. 

Will it ever arrive?

We're known for our reliable shipping and great customer service. We take the logistical side of our projects very seriously. Both of our previous campaigns have been delivered within a month of the estimate. 

We're ready for this, we've done it twice before and we're excited to do it again. All we need now is a cracking campaign to see it through.

We appreciate your support!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Dear Backers,
With great pleasure we can confirm fulfilment has begun on the Crew Playmats!

Themeborne is closing down for a few days for the Christmas holidays, and want to wish all our backers around the world a very Happy Christmas from the depths if the Dark Sector!
We'll be back in the new year with an update on the delivery estimates for the last few remaining items from this campaign, but with the ports currently looking like this (see below) we thank you for continuing to be patient - we promise you will all get everything you pledged for in the end, even if it takes another month or two to emerge from this madness.

Dear Backers, 
Following on from our last update, we've been informed that the arrival of the Crew playmats is now estimated for late November. That is for the European hub, and we're still waiting for word on the US hub arrival dates. 
This means we now estimate delivery to you of these last few items (books included) will take place in early December. We understand this is very frustrating news, and needless to say this is a very painful situation for us too in an already difficult time.

Dear Backers, 
We hope you've all been enjoying Escape the Dark Sector!
For those of you waiting on the Crew Playmats, we can confirm production was completed in September and we're still just awaiting on shipping news (as in shipping the playmats to our fulfilment centres).

Dear Backers,
Your amazing support of this campaign unlocked the stretch goal of an original soundtrack, free to all backers as a digital download. This marvellous creation is now available, and every backer will get an email invite this weekend from Backerkit with a link to where you can grab the MP3 files.
The soundtrack was specially composed by Alex Crispin to accompany the structure of gameplay:

Dear backers, 
Even though the game is now shipping, this is not goodbye! 
Over the years we are proud to have built up a great community of backers and players. We're lucky to have you, and while we will soon be moving away from this campaign page we wanted to let you know we're still here to help, and there are lots of ways you can continue to be involved.
Stay in touch

Shipping has begun!
Exciting news - we've now had confirmation that the North American hub has begun rolling out your rewards, and the European hub is in the final stages of prep -  expecting to begin shipping from there in a day or two.

campaign.story:
Visited our page before? 
Here're some updates you may have missed since your last visit.
All Stretch Goals UNLOCKED! (Keep scrolling down to see them)
5 New races artworks will be added (Aasimar, Genasi, Warforged, Goliath and Tabaxi)
 Sneak peek of Aasimar and Tabaxi race art 
Check out our 2nd video: Character Equipment screen (Scroll down a little bit more)
 Questions? It might be in our FAQs 
PLAY

UPDATE: We've been trying to refine the Character Equipment Screen design and we're pretty happy at where we ended up with. Check it out in the video below! 
PLAY

The races artworks we're currently supporting are... Dwarf, Tiefling, Dragonborn, Human, Half-elf, Half-orc, Gnome, Elf, Halfling, Aasimar, Genasi, Warforged, Goliath and Tabaxi.
Still having questions about the app? Check out the FAQs section for more answers.
STRETCH GOALS 
We're a husband & wife team who recently picked up D&D and fell in love with it. We are both avid gamers, so we thought that it would really amazing if we can customize our characters visually so that everyone at the table could see how their characters look like. 
There's also something satisfying about being able to visualize how your newly found Flame Tongue sword looks like on your character.
We happened to be both trained in design and art, and pixel art is something we're pretty good at. So that's how we started our Reroll journey, by doing this as a passion project outside of our daily jobs.
We have also engaged an awesome Development team to help us develop the app and also the website (if we hit our stretch goals). The prototype we've seen so far is absolutely amazing.
We have been doing this as a passion project with a development team handling the app programming. Kickstarter is a great way for us to validate how much demand there is for an app like this and fund the app development.
We also love crafting pixel art. The more we raise, the more likely we'll be able to spend more time doing this, or even be able to do this full-time! :)
The app is currently in development, and we have a basic prototype that is about 60-70% complete. We hope to complete development of the app and have a Beta version of the app ready by second half of 2019.
From then on, we will gather Beta feedback from you as we get the app ready for launch. As Kickstarter pledgers, you'll get your hands on the app months earlier before everyone else. 
At the same time, we'll always be working to add on more armors & weapons (and races if we hit that stretch goal).

Here's an update on our Beta Launch this week. We are waiting on Apple AppStore to approve the app right now. So we had to make some last minute workarounds (remove any mentions of Beta in the app) to get it approved. We have already submitted the app again and waiting on Apple's approval. Fingers crossed!

Hello folks! After months of app development, we're really excited to share a 'slightly-less-vague' date for Beta. :)
Beta will commence in mid-September 2019. 🤞
When we started the Kickstarter, we were initially aiming for August, but we had to delay the launch because we want to squeeze in most of our unlocked stretch goals into Beta. Here's a list of features to expect for Beta.

We had to change their names to Elementalists (Genasi), Catfolk (Tabaxi), Living Construct (Warforged) to avoid copyright issues.
Catfolk (More feline types added!)

Wow. What a ride. We have concluded our Kickstarter campaign with all Stretch Goals unlocked and a dream come true for us. 
The most unexpected thing that happened during this Kickstarter is... YOU.
We were showered with so much encouragement, feedback and support from all of you. We felt like we were not alone, you were there together with us in this Kickstarter journey.

campaign.story:
Old-School Essentials is an adventure role-playing game of exploration, danger, monsters, and magic. The game is intentionally rules-light, putting the focus of play on imagination, improvisation, and fun. The rules are optimised for ease of use at the table, with meticulous attention to wording and layout clarity. What's more, Old-School Essentials is 100% compatible with the classic Basic/Expert game from 1981, meaning that decades of adventure are at your fingertips!
Old-School Essentials comes in two forms: a chunky tome and a modular boxed set. The content is identical. Choose one or both, depending on your preferred format!
The first two Old-School Essentials supplements — adding extra classes, spells, and combat options — will be available as optional add-ons in BackerKit (following the completion of the Kickstarter)!
Digital mock-ups. Final products may vary. Some new cover art in progress.
See below for in-depth info on all products!
PDFs
All books will also be produced as extensively hyperlinked PDFs. Once the Kickstarter has finished, backers will get early access to PDFs in their current, near-finished forms. Once all artwork is in place and everything is finalised, the final PDFs will be sent out to backers.
Free Basic Rules PDF: To whet your appetite for this game, you can download a free PDF, featuring the basic rules for creating characters, adventuring in dungeons, combat, magic, and spells. Includes the complete rules for four classic fantasy character classes: the cleric, fighter, magic-user, and thief.
Killer Features of Old-School Essentials
Usability: Old-School Essentials is meticulously edited and laid out, with the aim of maximising ease of reference during play. No more searching for references scattered across multiple pages. No more scanning dense paragraphs of text to pick out details. Everything in Old-School Essentials is logically organised and collated, and presented in a quick-to-read format based on "control panels" — two-page spreads presenting a single topic in its entirety. (See page examples below or check out the free Basic Rules.)
Modularity: The rules of Old-School Essentials are divided into "modules" — cleanly separated chunks of related content. For example, the core rules of the game are cleanly separated from the rules for the classic fantasy character classes. This makes it simple to swap out any of the modular components of the game's rules with alternatives — perfect for referees who love to customise and tweak. We have lots of plans for further rules modules in the Old-School Essentials line, building on the core rules to take the game into a myriad of different settings and genres, from science fantasy to post-apocalyptic to sword and sorcery.
Convenience: All books are produced in handy A5 (Digest) size for convenient use at the table. The small, modular books in the Black Box make it easy to find what you need. Want to look up a spell? Just grab the book of spells. No need to navigate a big tome to find the right section.
Quality: We're set to produce the Old-School Essentials books at a deluxe level of quality — hardcovers with sewn bindings. These will be beautiful and seriously durable books!
Compatibility: Old-School Essentials is a 100% accurate restatement of the original Basic/Expert rules (B/X), with nothing added, changed, or removed. All material written for the B/X rules over the last 38 years can be used with Old-School Essentials, without any conversion effort whatsoever!
Refinement: The original Basic/Expert game presents a wondrously solid rules set, but the rules are not without areas of confusion and contradiction. All known omissions, contradictions, and areas of confusion have been carefully ironed out in Old-School Essentials.

A box full of adventure to fire up your nostalgia to the max! The Old-School Essentials core rules plus four rules modules for creating characters and running adventures in the classic fantasy genre. Each of the five books in the Black Box is described below.
Core Rules
72-page A5 hardcover
The core rules of the game, including procedures for: creating characters; exploring dungeons, the wilderness, and the high seas; combat, hazards, and challenges; retainers, hirelings, and vehicles; adventure design; magic, monsters, and treasures.
The Old-School Essentials core rules are carefully designed to be applicable to a multitude of fantastic campaign settings and genre conventions, from Classic Fantasy to Post-Apocalyptic to Sword and Planet. Just add a book of genre rules and you're ready for adventure!
A spread from the adventure design section
Classic Fantasy: Genre Rules
40-page A5 hardcover
Options for classic fantasy characters: classes, equipment, vehicles, hirelings, strongholds, and more. Play as a devout cleric or a sagacious magic-user, a doughty fighter or a cunning thief, a surly dwarf, a noble elf, or a homesick halfling. This book contains all character options from the Basic/Expert game.
Full rules for character advancement to 14th level.
The dwarf class — all on one spread
Classic Fantasy: Cleric and Magic-User Spells
40-page A5 hardcover; only required by players with spell-casting characters
All 106 magic spells that can be used by clerics, magic-users, and elves, ranging from 1st to 6th level. This book contains all spells from the Basic/Expert game.
Some high level magic-user spells
Classic Fantasy: Monsters
72-page A5 hardcover; only required by the referee
A timeless collection of over 200 fearsome beasts! Includes full encounter tables by dungeon level and wilderness terrain type. This book contains all monsters from the Basic/Expert game.
T-rex, unicorn, and vampire
Classic Fantasy: Treasures
40-page A5 hardcover; only required by the referee
A hoard of classic magic items, encompassing enchanted weapons and armour; magic wands, staves and rods; magical scrolls, rings, and potions; and the plethora of weird and wondrous items that don't fit into any of those categories! Includes full rules for sentient swords. This book contains all magic items from the Basic/Expert game.
Rules for sentient swords
For those who prefer all of their RPG rules in one book, rather than divided into modules — this is what you've been waiting for! Everything that's in the Black Box, combined into a single 256-page, A5 (Digest sized), hardcover tome.
The Old-School Essentials core rules plus all of the classic fantasy genre content, all in one meaty hardcover book. This book is a complete restatement of the Basic/Expert rules, meticulously edited and laid out for maximum usability and ease of reference.
Special Kickstarter Price!
Backers can get the Rules Tome at a reduced price of €25. The final retail price will be €30.
There's Also a Super-Deluxe Limited Edition!
In conjunction with our manufacturer, we're delighted to be able to offer a super-deluxe and highly limited edition of the Rules Tome, only available to backers of this Kickstarter!
The limited edition book will be wrapped in luxurious black leatherette, and foil stamped with the Old-School Essentials logo plus a design based on the cover illustration. (We'll post updates on that design as work on the cover illustration progresses.

The Rules Tome and the Black Box present a loving restatement of the classic Basic/Expert rules from the 1980s. But this is just the beginning of the Old-School Essentials line — we have many more books in the works, taking the game into a vista of different worlds and genres.
As part of this Kickstarter, we will also be producing a pair of hotly anticipated books to add Advanced magic and character options to your games! These new options are inspired by the beloved Advanced rules from the 1970s, and carefully scaled to mesh smoothly with the lower Basic/Expert levels of power and rules complexity.
Advanced Fantasy: Genre Rules
56-page A5 hardcover
This book adds:
 9 new human classes: acrobat, assassin, barbarian, bard, druid, illusionist, knight, paladin, ranger.
 6 new demihuman race-classes: drow, duergar, gnome, half-elf, half-orc, svirfneblin.
Optional rules for choosing race and class separately.
Advanced rules for poisons, combat options, and more.
Advanced Fantasy: Druid and Illusionist Spells
40-page A5 hardcover; only required by players with spell-casting characters
106 new spells that can be used by bards, druids, gnomes, and illusionists, ranging from 1st to 6th level.
More Advanced Fantasy Books...
We plan to continue expanding Old-School Essentials with more Advanced books, bringing in monsters and magic items inspired by the Advanced rules.

Deluxe Quality
All books in these deluxe editions will be high quality hardcovers with sewn bindings. In addition to their high durability, a great thing about books with a sewn binding is that they can lay open flat!
What's more, we have stretch goals lined up for extra trimmings, to further increase the quality of these books. See below for more info on what we have planned, if the initial funding goal is surpassed.
The Team
Wondering who's behind all of this? Allow us to elucidate:
Gavin Norman: Author of Old-School Essentials (and formerly B/X Essentials), co-creator and principle author of the critically acclaimed Dolmenwood campaign setting, and founder of Necrotic Gnome. Gavin has driven the Old-School Essentials project since its inception, and is the mastermind behind the writing, editing, and layout.
Andrew Walter: Visual genius behind a vista of weirdness, including Dolmenwood and Troika! Andrew's flights of imaginative fantasy feature on the covers of the five books in the Black Box. Four of these are complete (as shown in the product mock-up above). Andrew is now working on a completely new cover for the Core Rules book in the Black Box.
Peter Mullen: Revered for his fantastically imaginative work on the Dungeon Crawl Classics RPG and many other old-school games, Peter is working on a brand new piece that will grace the cover of the Black Box and the Rules Tome, and full 4-panel art for the front of the referee screen!
Stefan Poag: Prolific and beloved creator of weird and wonderful fantasy art, including many pieces for the Mutant Crawl Classics RPG, Metamorphosis Alpha, and many others. Stefan created the cover art for the Advanced Fantasy rules modules.
Interior artists: A crack team of artists is tackling the interior illustration of the books, including: Luka Rejec, Matt Ray, Michael Clarke, Alex Mayo, Tom Kilian, Sean Poppe, Kyle Latino, Thomas Novosel.
Plus full-colour art plates by: Thomas Denmark, Rachel Quinlan, Jon Hodgson, Olivia Politz, Tom Kilian, Sam Mameli, Emma Lazauski.
What's This About 1981?
The 1981 Basic/Expert Fantasy Adventure Game sets (also known as B/X) have experienced a vibrant renaissance over the last decade. Many players have returned to (or discovered for the first time!) the simple rules and imaginative open space of the Basic/Expert game, with the focus on ease of play, adventure, wonder, and mystery.
Renewed interest in this vintage game has led to the creation of a wide array of retro-clones: games that restate or are inspired by the rules of the Basic/Expert sets. In fact, the B/X rules (and games based on them) are the most popular rules in use in the old-school gaming scene.
Old-School Essentials is exactly such a retro-clone, and we're immensely proud to be a part of the renaissance of these beloved rules.
100% Rules Accuracy
The material in the Black Box and the Rules Tome forms a complete retelling of the classic Basic/Expert rules, including all of the classic fantasy classes, spells, monsters, and treasures.
Old-School Essentials has been developed with equal measures of love and precision. The ultimate aim of this project is to produce as accurate as possible a restatement of the revered B/X rules, while improving the structure and presentation, and fixing errors and contradictions in the original rules. (For those with a passion for rules archaeology, this document describes all the areas of the Basic/Expert rules which are clarified in Old-School Essentials.)
The resulting books are the product of over two years of meticulous research, rules archaeology, and discussion.
A Single Optional Addition — Ascending Armour Class
Modern iterations of the world's most popular RPG use an Armour Class system where AC values start at 10 and go up. This is known as Ascending Armour Class. (The default Armour Class system in B/X has AC starting at 9 and going down, known as Descending Armour Class.)
For those more familiar or comfortable with Ascending Armour Class, this optional rule has been fully integrated into Old-School Essentials. All AC ratings are presented in a dual format, for example: AC 7 [12].
This is the single rule we've added to the game that is not present in the original Basic/Expert rules, and it is strictly optional — Descending AC remains the default.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our first Kickstarter (so please help us make it an overwhelming success!). That said, Necrotic Gnome has been relentlessly producing high quality old-school content since 2012. The team behind Old-School Essentials is by no means new to producing games! We are renowned for our communicative and transparent development process, so you can be sure of receiving a steady stream of updates as the project progresses.

The risks involved in this project are low. The text of the Rules Tome and the books in the Black Box is 100% finished. The layout of all books is done. The cover art for most of the books is done. About 50% of the interior illustrations are in place. All that remains, development-wise, is for the artists to get working on the final illustrations, to be slotted into the layout.

We've previously worked with the printer who'll be manufacturing the books, so their professionalism and commitment to high quality are known factors. They do excellent work, fast.

The box manufacturer isn't someone we've worked with before, so that is a slight unknown, but in case of an utter fall-through in communication, we have a second box manufacturer lined up.

As for the stretch goals, the majority of them are designed such that they will not add delays to the production and fulfillment of the main campaign goals:
• The physical upgrades to the books don't entail any additional development time. (They just cost extra!)
• The referee screen (as noted above) will be shipped separately from the books / box, so any unexpected delays in development there will not delay the whole project.
• Development of all the digital stretch goals (character sheet PDFs, the rules reference website, etc.) likewise does not impact the delivery of the books / box.

The stretch goals that require additional print production (the Advanced books and the introductory adventure) are the main extras that could, in principle, cause delays. However, all of those products are already written. They just need to be laid out and illustrated. This extra work has already been factored into the planned shipping dates, so the risk is minimal.

updates.update_content:
Hey everyone,
It's been a while since I posted an update here but in those intervening months I have not been idle!
New Old-School Essentials Books Coming to Kickstarter August 12th!

Hey everyone,

campaign.story:
Oceans is a 2-4 player strategy game in the Evolution game series where you create a vibrant web of marine life through millions of years of evolution. Whatever version of Oceans you pledge for, it will automatically come with a 5-6 player expansion.
The Evolution games are known for vivid themes, easy rules, and hidden depth. With many thousands of play-tests, years of non-stop design, over 100 unique illustrations, and more content than we've ever put into a game before, Oceans is our most ambitious project to date.
At the game's start, the only food source is plankton, the foundation of the ocean food web. It populates the beautifully illustrated Reef and Ocean boards, shown here as prototypes: 
(Note the fish tokens you see above are off-the-shelf items we used for testing. The actual tokens will be cardboard for the standard edition and acrylic for the deluxe edition. See below.)
Your goal is to create and evolve species so they find their niche in the growing ecosystem, by giving them helpful combinations of traits. This is a what a species looks like: 
Each species is defined by its population (the fish tokens above), and its traits (the cards above). Through the game It'll gain and lose traits, and gain and lose population depending on what it can eat, and what can eat it. Despite your best efforts, some species will go extinct! It's natural selection at work. 
Because you can build species from any combination of traits, thousands of species are possible, and they all interact in their own particular ways as the ecosystem builds. Every game creates a one-of-a-kind world, never to be seen again.   
Many species will be predators, each bigger than the next, all the way up to the dreaded apex predator. But some will eat in other ways, for example by scavenging on the sea bottom or filter-feeding on plankton. Below are examples of trait art - each a watercolor painting by famed nature artist Catherine Hamilton:
Then there's a whole other side to the game. It's called The Deep. 
Huge regions of deep ocean are unexplored, and what little we've seen of them can seem like fantasy:
We had to put this mysterious world into the game. Hence The Deep.
The Deep will contain, at minimum, 50 unique, powerful traits, which dramatically boost the range - and strangeness - of species you can evolve. We commissioned scores of illustrations from a variety of fine artists to make them. Here are examples:   
Through unlocked stretch goals, at least 32 additional Deep cards may become permanently added to the game. 
Beyond those, there are also 8 foiled Deep promo cards to unlock. These foiled traits are more aggressive and/or complex than the other cards in the game. 
With all stretch goals unlocked, you'll get more than 90 unique Deep cards in total. They raise the number of distinct species you can evolve from thousands to about one million.
Each time you play, there are 2 scenario cards in play (chosen at random at the start of the game from a deck of at least 25). Each creates a major ecosystem-shift when activated, altering the whole game. It's another way the evolutionary timeline changes each play.
The standard scenario deck can create about 600 distinct Ocean histories to evolve through, but we're also offering up to 13 more scenario cards as stretch goals. With those added, about 1500 Ocean histories are possible. 
We've packed all this into rules that are simpler, more intuitive, and easier to teach even than Evolution, which was already known for being easy to teach. Nonetheless you'll find tons of hidden tactics and strategies...under the surface. 
Note: Oceans is mechanically quite different from previous Evolution games. See this update for details.  
 For every pledge level, at the end of the campaign, you'll choose between English, French, Spanish and Italian versions of Oceans in the pledge manager. You can pledge for as many copies as you wish.
 North Star Games will publish the English version
 Funforge will publish the French version. Pour voir cette page en français, cliquez ici! 
 Schwerkraft-Verlag will publish the German Edition. 
 Ediciones MasQueOca will publish the Spanish version. You can read their updates about Oceans at their blog here.
 Pendragon Game Studio will publish the Italian version. To read about this campaign in, click here.
Standard Edition Pledge Level - $45 USD ($5 off MSRP)
You get the Oceans Standard Edition and all unlocked stretch goals. 
The Standard Edition contains:  1 Rulebook, 1 Reference Guide, 2 Player aids, 1 Reef board, 3 Ocean boards (2 small, 1 large), 120 Surface cards (10 of each type), 50-80 Deep cards (1 of each type), 24 Scenario cards, 24 Species boards, 200 cardboard fish with 6 different illustrated designs (see below), 4 Player screens, and 4 Bonus Score tokens. Note exact numbers of some components could change with final game tweaks.
The 5-6 player expansion contains 40 additional fish, 2 extra player screens, 2 extra bonus score tokens, and 10 extra species boards.  
Note: unlike in the prototype pictured above, the final cardboard fish will be illustrated on both sides: 
Deluxe Edition Pledge Level - $70 ($15 off MSRP)
You get Oceans' Deluxe Edition and all unlocked stretch goals. The Deluxe Edition improves on the Standard Edition in the following ways:
Includes 240 deluxe translucent acrylic fish tokens in addition to the cardboard fish of the standard edition, so you can decide how you want to play. The acrylic fish are more durable, easier to handle, and they refract light beautifully. Our goal is to make them as delicious-looking and as tactile as possible. We'll have done our job if your first instinct is to eat them. Prototype:
The final version may look even better, as they'll have smooth, beveled edges.
Includes custom-printed, premium food bags for up to 6 players for storing your points, instead of cardboard player screens. They feel super-silky, they have drawstrings, and they help keep your playing area neat and compact. 
Includes 220 custom Oceans premium matte card sleeves, for sleeving both the core trait cards and The Deep trait cards, plus spares. 
Box Cover Art Painting Pledge Level - $3000
You get the Deluxe Edition, all unlocked stretch goals, and Catherine Hamilton's original 12" x 12" watercolor painting for the Box Cover. Because the painting is one-of-a-kind, only one backer can pledge this level: 
Pledge levels which are no longer available
There are a number of pledge levels with backer limits that have been reached, and so are no longer available. To simplify this page, we've removed descriptions of these levels for now. We'll add them back in if any become available again.
Whatever language you choose for your game, your stretch goals will also come in that language. There are three types of stretch goals: 
 Deep Cards: Unlocked Deep traits that will become a permanent part of both the Standard and Deluxe Editions. Each card that isn't unlocked may be available on our website for $2.  
 Foiled Deep Cards: Promo Deep traits that are more aggressive and/or complex than normal Deep traits. After the campaign, each foiled card may be available on our website for $3 if there are any left over. 
 Scenario Cards: Promo scenarios that are wackier than the standard scenarios. Some are downright goofy. After the campaign, each scenario card may be available on our website for $1 if there are any left over. 
The total value of all stretch goals is more than $100.
You can order as many of each add-on as you like. Note the non-digital add-ons will add extra shipping cost, which will be charged after the campaign ends in our pledge manager.
Evolution (English or Italian) - add $40 to your pledge for each English copy, $35 for each Italian copy
Evolution is an award-winning board game where 2 – 6 players adapt terrestrial species in an ever changing ecosystem with hungry predators and limited resources. The game has been used in the evolutionary biology department at the University of Oxford and featured in the world's leading scientific journal, Nature. You'll be able to choose between English and Italian versions in the pledge manager after the campaign ends.
Evolution Video Game (English Only)
Add $12 to your pledge for a Steam code (20% off). In the pledge manager at campaign's end, it may also be possible to add-on iOS and Android versions.
We've turned Evolution into a video game for iOS, Android, and Steam. It's got lots of new content and modes of play, and a refined interface. The learn-as-you-play tutorial makes it perhaps the easiest way to learn Evolution.
Evolution: Climate Standalone (English Only) - add $60 to your pledge for each copy
Climate is a more advanced version of Evolution, where you must contend not only with other species, but also with a changing climate that can swing from scorching hot to icy cold, and major environmental disruptions like drought and meteor impacts.
Evolution: The Beginning (English Only) - add $25 to your pledge for each copy
The Beginning is a faster, simpler, more casual Evolution experience than its parent game. It's especially good for playing with young kids (8 and up) and it works very well for 2 players.
Evolution Foiled Promo Card Pack #1 (English Only) - add $12 to your pledge for each pack
This pack contains 7 copies each of 5 foiled promo traits that that can be used in both Evolution and Evolution: Climate. We normally sell each trait for $5 each (and not all of them foiled). With this pack you save more than 50% on each card. The cards are: Extra Sensory Perception, Cybernetic Limbs, Gigantism, Venom, Unstable DNA.
Evolution Foiled Promo Card Pack #2 (English Only) - add $17 to your pledge for each pack
This pack contains 7 copies each of 7 foiled promo traits that that can be used in both Evolution and Evolution: Climate. We normally sell each trait for $5 each (and not all of them foiled). With this pack you save more than 50% on each card. The cards are: Sharp Teeth, Rapid Mutation, Pest, Invasive Species, Pounce, Quills, and Last Stand.
Evolution Foiled Promo Card Pack #3 (English Only) - add $15 to your pledge for each pack
This pack contains 7 copies each of 6 foiled promo traits that that can be used in both Evolution and Evolution: Climate. We normally sell each trait for $5 each (and not all of them foiled). With this pack you save 50% on each card. The cards are: Mimicry, Trample, Timid, Insectivore, Coprophagia, and Claws.
Premium, Custom Deep Deck Tray by Dog Might Games - add $49 to your pledge
This custom Oceans card tray is crafted by the Viking Lumberjacks at Dog Might Games. Built to fit the Deep Deck, the trays are built using Culry Birch and feature the Oceans logo fully sculpted into the wood and Dog Might's custom Azul stain. The Trays measure 12 x 3.25 x 2.75" and fit both sleeved and unsleeved cards. Like all Dog Might products, the Trays come with a lifetime guarantee. Check out more of their Gaming Gear at dogmight.com.
Note these trays will be fulfilled separately from the rest of your pledge, direct from Dog Might Games. You'll be charged for shipping in the pledge manager after the campaign ends. Here are shipping estimates to common locations:

Current Goal



Welcome to Humblewood! 
Humblewood is an exciting new Campaign Setting for 5e DND that includes original birdfolk player races, new monsters, magic items, and a compelling adventure for 1st to 5th level characters.
 The World
In the world of Everden, nestled between the mighty Crest mountain range and the vast marshes of the Mokk Fields, lies a mystical forest known as Humblewood that hums with the Great Rhythm of nature. It has been ruled for generations by the birdfolk who inhabit the Great Tree-City of Alderheart. Humblewood has endured for centuries thanks to the industry and compassion of its people...
...but now the fires have come, and the Woods have been thrown into chaos. Flames ravage the land and destroy the homes of the humblefolk, stoking a growing resentment against the birdfolk, whose cities have managed to avoid the worst of the fires so far. Hatred burns in the hearts of those who have lost lives they cherished, and these once peaceful peoples now take up the sword and turn to banditry. The disaffected turn their gaze on Alderheart, and threaten to reduce an age of peace to ashes... 
...yet there is still hope. Even in these dark times, brave heroes can be found within the Wood. Only they can quell the raging flames that have been unleashed upon the land, and restore balance to the realm. Will you answer the call?    
Residents of Humblewood
The Birdfolk 

The birdfolk races have ruled over Humblewood from their canopy villages and fortified cities for as long as anyone can remember. Play as one of the five core birdfolk races:
The astute crow-like Corvum who safeguard Humblewood’s knowledge
The dignified fowl-like Gallus who have faith in the power of community
The aloof pidgeon-like Lumas who use their gifts to bring joy into the world
The agile hawk-like Raptors who blaze new trails through the forest
The powerful owl-like Strig who defend what they believe is right
The Humblefolk
The humblefolk live in small villages throughout the Wood, but are occasionally found in birdfolk cities. Play as one of the five core humblefolk races:
The hearty deer-like Cerva who strive to achieve their goals 
The sensitive hedgehog-like Hedges whose empathy lets them see what others cannot
The brave mouse-like Jerbeen who inspire those around them with deeds of heroism
The resourceful raccoon-like Mapach who can craft a solution to any problem
The cunning fox-like Vulpin who are always one step ahead of their foes
The Bandits
Once a loosely organized confederacy of crime, its ranks have swelled with humblefolk displaced by the spreading fires who have turned to banditry to survive. Under the guidance of a new leader, they seek to exact retribution upon the birdfolk cities and sow discord throughout the Wood.
Monsters of Humblewood
The Oozes
Deep within the murk of the Mokk Fields live several species of this most resilient life-form. Battle your way through caustic slimes whose touch is a deadly acid, sticky slimes that can suck a weapon right out of your hand, and the rare shifting slimes which feed on magical energies to become ever stronger. 
The Beasts
Humblewood is home to a variety of beasts whose size, strength, and abilities can only have grown thanks to the Wood’s magic. Face craggy skinned mountain lions whose roar can summon rockslides, hunt the deadly forest prowlers in their woodland lair, and tangle with the giant sea monster (art coming soon!) in a battle on the high sea!
The Elements of Flame

The great calamity which produced the part of Humblewood known as the Scorched Grove also made the area an ideal home for fiery creatures. Withstand the searing heat of an emberbat swarm: a vortex of tiny flying creatures, each one a smouldering ember with wings! Confront the terrifying ashsnake and it’s deadly pyroclastic breath! Legends say there may even be a primal elemental force lurking within the Scorched Grove. Have you the courage to find out? 
This campaign is shipping friendly to USA, European Union and Canada.

campaign.story:
The Retroverse lives! Welcome to an exciting new 5E universe from Lasers & Liches! It is an unbound universe bursting with half-faded memories, barely remembered songs, lost childhood friends, outdated styles, vaporwave, abandoned dreams, lost playthings, vaporware, and time corroded nostalgia. A place both strange and familiar. A place  for adventure,chaos, friendship, and the magic of yesteryear. In short, a place that combines your love of the present with your adoration of the past. 
Do you feel like your 5E game might be  missing something? Maybe a little Retro-Futurism?  We did too! It's time to get weird, time to get crazy, time for more freaking laser corgis! Lasers & Liches mixes untethered creativity with sci-fantasy and wraps it in the veneer of  yesteryear. Expect neon swords, Code Dragons, Pizza Slimes, and so much nostalgia inspired world building. Don't worry though, we know that your memories are sacred, and that's why we're going to treat them with care. This was our childhood too and we are giving it the respect it darn well deserves. Callbacks are easy, and this ain't gonna be easy.  
So, what is the Retroverse? Technically speaking, the Retroverse is an unstable plane. It is constantly expanding, contracting, and gaining new extensions. It wobbles on an uneven axis among the other planes of existence. Because if this, it eventually intersects all  realities in one way or another. There is no point in time when it is not linked to multiple realms at once. Where the Retroverse ends, begins, or even exists at any given time is an impossible question to  answer. 
This means that you can take anything, from any 5E setting, and mash it together. Classic 5E content, mixed with Retroverse classes and species, fighting other 3rd party monsters, across a setting from your favorite cartoon?! You betcha! This doesn't overhaul 5E with a bunch of revised rules, it just makes the game cooler in every way. 
Our Website: LasersAndLiches.com
 We are creating a full 5E universe and need your help to bring it to life. This Kickstarter is focused on finalizing our content and bringing it all together into a two-book PDF format. (Why only PDF? See below) These will include new classes, playable species, spells, monsters, magic items, mechanics, deities, story, and a bunch more! We have been tirelessly pouring over our art and design to give you the best possible 5E experience and just need your assistance to bring it to light. The two PDFs we want to bring to you are The Player's Mix and The Game Master's Beats. Both will be filled to the brim with beautiful art, fun new options, and a few surprises. We have a minimum idea in mind for each and some really exciting features to include if we hit certain stretch goals. 
To those that have followed our project so far, you know what you're getting into. We released our First Test Wave of content for free on DriveThruRPG. Well, we are happy to announce that we have the Second Test Wave ready to go! It is well over 400 pages of new or revised content just waiting for you to play. Backers will get this content within a few days of the campaign ending in successful funding. You can play with all our new stuff almost as soon as the campaign ends!
The Player's Mix:  This PDF will be everything a player needs to bring their Retroverse  character to life in their own world. It will feature at least 4 new classes, 4 new playable species, 4 new backgrounds, 40 new spells, 8 new feats, new sub-classes and sub-species for classic 5E, and a few other surprises!
These numbers begin to jump dramatically as we unlock more stretch goals. We also have a few more surprises to add in that we think you'll enjoy. 
The Game Master's Beats: This PDF will dive deep into the lore of The Retroverse. It will offer new rules, a full campaign, 40 new magic items, 40 new monsters, a world map, and rules for adapting and creating your own settings in the Retroverse!
Just like the Player's Mix, this will receive a huge boon if we hit certain stretch goals. Which includes but is not limited to: An expanded campaign, remixed questlines, more magic items, more monster stat blocks, and we will release a very unique type of lich upon your world!
 If you have been following our project, you may know that we tried a Kickstarter once before. We were well on our way to funding but overestimated some things. So, after only 4 days, we pulled the project before anyone was charged. We've written at length about why but the TL;DR version is that the extra goals we had in place would not be worth it to backers and pull too heavily from the project, making the whole thing suffer. So we went back to the drawing board, spent around a year improving our product, and are coming back with a more focused goal. This Kickstarter is almost entirely geared on just finishing the project in the most affordable (for us and backers) way possible. 
The biggest changes to the game have already been made and are in our second test wave. The content now includes: 5 new playable species, 6 new classes (4 with 3 new sub-classes), 7 new backgrounds, 80+ new spells, 70+ new monster stat blocks, new sub-classes for core 5E classes, improved corruption, a new cliche mechanic, more deities, expanded basic equipment, and a bunch bunch more. 
You may notice that this is above some of our previous stretch goals and even above our base content offered in this Kickstarter. That's because we are committed to not just delivering, but over delivering on this project. If we only hit the base funding, we will scale the project back a touch and include just a little more than you hoped for. With every new stretch goal, we increase the content coming towards you and bring an even more insane experience to your table. It's up to you to decide the final outcome!
We thought you needed more dinosaurs.
We thought you needed more dragons too.
If we already have a base product, why Kickstart it? There are 3 major reasons but the biggest one is editing is expensive. Lets break down all 3.
 Editing: Editing costs money, editing a lot of content (such as our game) costs a lot of money. Properly paying an editor is way beyond our meager capabilities, so we need your help to get there. This is where the bulk of all funding is going. 
 Not Done: While we have a ton of content created, we are not quite where we want to be. We are still in development and our team has families and bills. Creating in our off time has spawned a huge amount of content, imagine what we could do if we could worry a bit less about food. 
 Immortalize You: The Retroverse has been a community project since its first inception as a string of tweets. We love how much people enjoy our universe and the different ways they interact with it. This Kickstarter gives us the chance to get you into the universe canonically, making you a permanent part of this world. 
Yes, our game has Laser Corgis. No, you shouldn't pet them.
 When we went back to the Kickstarter drawing board, we decided we wanted to keep the next one very tight. This was our way of focusing on the project without lots of fees, taxes, shipping, and other headaches nibbling away at the funds until nothing was left. Once the PDFs are finalized and fully distributed, we will be running another Kickstarter for the hardcover books (in addition to some other cool merchandise) but that is not this Kickstarter. The focus now is project completion and giving you a hand in development. The hardcover copy Kickstarter will have awesome rewards, but none that get you in the main books like this one. 
Print on Demand through DriveThruRPG (which is who will be fulfilling the PDF distribution) is a great option for many creators but is not the route we want to take. There are some surprises we have planned that they simply cannot do. We know there is a great desire for physical books, and we want them as well, but not as much as we want to bring you the best game possible. Without this Kickstarter campaign, a physical book will continue to remain beyond our means. We need your help now to bring this project from a dream, to your table. 
The Nostalgia Blaster stretch goal is the only tier that will have physical rewards. We're saving some of the details until it is unlocked but it will include a set of our Tesla Dragon dice (below), some exclusive slap bracelets, an exclusive laser corgi pin, and a few other surprises. This will be the only way to get these items as well, as only the dice will ever see a reprint and not for a long time. 
All Retroverse dice are crafted by Luck Gnomes.
This isn't our first dice/bracelet rodeo.
Looks like we have unlocked the Nostalgia Blaster tier! It is available as a full tier or as an add-on. If you are at the Tester tier or higher, simply add $25 to your pledge and its added automatically. Anyone backing us over $100 already has this pack added to their tier at no extra charge. It's our way of thanking you for backing us big and early. Shipping will be charged in BackerKit once the campaign ends. We also unlock extra stuff for the pack each time we hit a new stretch goal. What stuff? Keep up with our updates to find out! 
The dice are based on the Tesla Dragon, seen here with the Laser, Xenon, and Neon dragons.
 What are some of the new Classes we want to introduce? The full base game will include the Holo-Knight, Synth Weaver, Henshin (formerly Goreangyr), and De-Fragger! You can see pictures of them below. We also hope to expand the roster (with your funding help) to include the Apogee (formerly Code Warlock), Glitch Hunter, Datamancer, and Icon. We promise to work on them until they are as fun as can possibly be!
All the classes available in the First Test Wave have been broken apart, injected with essence of cool, and put back together with 3 new sub-classes! The Holo-Knight now has the Hard, Soft, and Quantum Light sub-classes. The Synth Weaver now has the Beat Booster, Beat Mixer, and Beat Breaker possibilities (as well as a complete backbone overhaul). The Henshin now includes three mask types, Power, Magic, and Speed, depending on which type of spandex warrior you want to employ. And the De-Fragger has the Vaccine, Data, and Virus sub-classes, depending on how you handle corruption. We've spent a ton of time working on them (and taking your feedback) to make them even cooler than they already were. 
Clockwise from the top: Synthweaver, De-Fragger, Glitch Hunter, Henshin, Holo-Knight, Apogee.
One of our Holo-Knight sub-classes.
A Restless Vaccine De-Fragger.
A Beat Mixer Synthweaver.
A Speed Mask Henshin riding their Network Cycle.
There is a lot to the Retroverse. A LOT. In order to make it manageable and to continue to be able to test new and exciting features (and sleep!), we are breaking the testing period into waves. It also allows you to play with our stuff as its being developed, no waiting for the final versions to play! When the Kickstarter  ends (if we are funded) we will release the second wave to anyone over a certain backer level (this will be the only way to get this content for now). It includes well over 400 pages of brand new content! You can play with some of the new classes and sub-classes, playable species, magic, monsters, magic items, and rules almost immediately! It also comes with the next chapter in the Warren's Grove campaign, giving you two missions (3 with our free Halloween special) to play! Each new wave will have an additional quest, growing to the eventual full campaign to be included in the Game Master's Beats. (There will also be some missions in the Game Master's Beats that are not available in the test waves.)
In a few months time we will release the third test wave. There is not a set date for this as the amount of  content within the third test wave is highly dependent on how  successful the Kickstarter is. We want to make sure that, even though we are still testing it, we release quality content to you. We are not going to rush this project. If there needs to be more test waves, then we simply do more. 
As a backer you will have full access to the development process with frequent updates. You will know exactly when the third (and maybe more) test waves are coming!
 If you would like to try a sample of what we are making, head on over to our DriveThruRPG page and download the Silver Best Selling (NOW ELECTRUM) First Test Wave or our Halloween Special. They're 200+ combined pages of pure awesome. Did we mention they are free? 
Lasers & Liches First Test Wave  
Lasers & Liches Halloween Special
 You can also see some live play sessions of our game here. 
A possible "shiny" version of a dragon wyrmling.
 Here's what some people have been saying about the Retroverse!
 As we hit certain stretch goals, we will reveal more specifics about each one. 

Updated 3/10

Chris Lock and LLuis Abadias are the powerhouse duo that comprise the entirety of the Lasers & Liches team. After bonding over a mutual love of the absurd nature of retro-futurism, a general malaise for traditional fantasy, and a love of lasers, they began working on the Retroverse project. Their love of the silly, love for their community, and love for each other has pushed this project to places neither of them would have thought possible. Between the two of them, they have run years of games, created several mildly successful projects, and generated a ton of free content for the TTRPG community. They both live on twitter. Chris: @Snickelsox LLuis: @LluisAbadias 
She says "Back this project of I'll eat you." We think she's serious.

The hardest thing about making this project has been balancing life around it. It is a two man team and yet we have a ton of content already created. We are not just creating a supplement, we are creating a brand new universe. We need your help to take this from a side project, to a main focus. If funded, we will create exactly what we have promised. There will certainly be some challenges we will face but we have made it this far with next to no funding and working in our spare time. Limiting our scope to just a PDF for now will ensure that we will deliver.
